intro: Sphenogyne abrotanifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sphenogyne, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant morphology and ecology.
